intro: Dalea bicolor var. naviculifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators in its native range.
